result.execSummary:
The defendant Heidi L Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Reduction base upon successful completion of OWI Court.

miscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

No alcohol, bars or taverns.

Do not operate a motor vehicle until properly reinstated in Wisconsin.
.

Pay DOC supervision fees.

Random testing.

Defendant to have sobrietor in her home.

Sign release.

Participate in Thinking for a Chrange.

Any other conditons deemed appropriate by the agrent.

 If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available actions will be used to collect the debt.
.

timeConds.notes: 1st 48 hours without release.  Apply credit to the 48 hours.  Defendant to participate in the OWI Court Program

Defendant pleads guilty to OWI 4th.
Remaining counts dismissed and read in.

SENTENCE:  Withheld, probation 1 year.
6 months county jail - 1st 48 hours without release.  2 days credit.  Apply credit to the 48 hours.
Fine and costs totaling $3849 - defendant to pay $25 a month starting 2-1-15.
$25 blood draw.  Defendant to participate in OWI Court.  DL revoked 36 months.  Can be reduced to 24 months with completion of OWI Court.
IID 24 months - hardship waiver.  AA & DSP.  No alcohol, bars or taverns.  Random testing with sborieter in the home.    Do not operate a motor vehicle until properly reinstated in Wisconsin.  Continue in AODA counseling.  Sign release.  Thinking for a change.  Any other conditions deemed appropriate by the PO
